place_description:
Sunflour Baking Company is a local family run bakery. Enjoy fresh, from scratch pastries along with fresh brewed coffee and free WiFi. It's a great place to work, meet, relax, and more.

Visit our cafe in Ballantyne for delicious "from scratch" pastries, cappuccinos, and grilled sandwiches.
We are conveniently located near Ballantyne Business Park and offer delivery in the general area along with in-store and curbside pickup.
Try a breakfast sandwich on a homemade croissant. Or a from scratch french macaron that melts in your mouth. We love making people smile and we're doing it every day on Conlan Circle in Ballantyne.

reviews_data.review_text: My favorite bakery for coffee and something sweet or a sandwich
Everything here is delicious!

Baked goods are very good,  though I avoid vegan and gluten free.  Cappuccinos are too bitter.  Really nice atmosphere  - not crowded,  open and well-lit even when rainy.  Their sandwiches are very good.

Their food is great but the service is not. Pretty much every time I'm here they either lose my order or half of it and I have to ask them where is my xyz. I keep coming back because I like their paninis.

We started off with a massive almond croissant. The layers inside were so delicious. It also had some almond paste inside which was very good.  Both of the breakfast sandwiches were amazing. The homemade breads really made them great :)

To start, the croissants are very good. However, was a little disappointed with the egg and bacon - bacon was very thin and the eggs were "different". Wish it was a regular fried egg instead of the one received. And a bacon that did not remind me of precooked bacon - maybe a thicker cut too - would have made it better.
Iced mocha was good once it cooled down - first few sips were room temp because it seemed the hot coffee was put in the cup first instead of ice first - took a bit to finally cool down.
I can appreciate the made from scratch pastries and I do understand the costs of running a small business. However to spend $32 for two drinks and two bacon, egg, cheese sandwiches seemed a little pricey.
Will return just not as often due to cost.
One of my favorite places in Charlotte. Much love.

Sunflour did my wedding cake and it was the most gorgeous cake I have ever seen in my life. They took my vision and made it even better than I could imagine and wow did it taste good. And it was gluten free! I got so many compliments about how good the cake was at my wedding, which is a big deal because wedding cakes usually don't taste that good!
The coffee is great, the breakfast selection is fantastic, and the homemade pastries are delicious. Highly recommend this spot for anyone looking for a cozy and delicious start to their day!

Found this spot because it was close to my hotel and I'm so glad I did. I'll definitely make this a regular visit location. Bravo to the spot! I love the play on the name Sunflour: indicating everything is baked in house. The fact that they had lots of Vegan options for me and even more options for my family was amazing. I of course got the Lavender 5 shots Latte with Oat Milk and it was probably one of the best cups I've ever had. You could actually smell the lavender. The foam was perfect and the cup was just delightful delicious. I also bought 4 cupcakes ( 2 red velvet, 1 lemon & 1 pistachio) they didn't even make it home the kids ate them up. I was told they were finger licking good. I also purchased 2 vegan scones, 1 cheddar & chive biscuits & 1 cinnamon roll. I think I paid $40 for 8 bakery items & 2 lattes. So the price was great  this spot is a must if you love fresh food made with love and good ingredients.
Great little place. GF cookies are amazing.
Great selection and friendly staff.
Quaint spot with amazing food, pastries and coffee. Definitely recommend checking it out!

Hands down the best bakery in the town. We visit here every weekend from south carolina to have breakfast. Chocolate banana muffin and orange hazelnut rolls are our family favorites. Staff is extremely polite and thoughtful. They make great coffee too.
Really liked it good gluten free selection. GF scones were great!
Too much sugar in their products. But their croissants are great.

The pastries are so delicious!.
The coffee with pistachio milk is
So friendly, food is always so fresh and tasty, strong rec
The mocha chip muffin was so good!
I love customer service, I love the food, and the atmosphere is great
Always a family favorite
I found this place online. Went to get a loaf of rosemary bread and found a few other things also. The bread was delicious, and the gluten-free vegan chocolate doughts were too.
If you are looking for a quaint, personable, clean place to meet a friend or work remotely, and have great food and beverage, this is the place! What a GEM of a spot!
Delicious coffee and sandwiches. Beautiful cupcakes.

How do you not give this place five stars? The food and service are always great. The pasties are amazing! And don't sleep on their sandwiches. I highly recommend the sugar rolls. They are light and flaky with sugar that will make you want another one. Their muffins are some of the best in Charlotte. The blueberry is delicious, but I love the Snickerdoodle muffin! They also make excellent coffee. I usually get the iced caramel latte. Sunflour has a decent amount of seating inside. There is also a patio for the warmer months. Please go check it out!

Great bakery tucked away in this lovely little shopping plaza. They had treats for visiting dogs and dog bowls outside. They sold out of some items in the time myself and friends caught up, so you know it was a good spot. Coffee drinks took a while to make, but it was a busy holiday weekend morning so that makes sense. Definitely on my list for Charlotte, NC visits in the future.
I enjoyed the snickerdoodle muffin, it was great. My family and I had a good time. Thank you.
The best multi grain bread for the tuna melt.  Cupcakes are also great!! Friendly service
Just amazing foods !

My favorite Charlotte Bakery!  Too many goodies to choose from. The best breakfast burrito. Always get a loaf of the rosemary sourdough when hosting. Vegan options are always delicious! Highly recommend the zucchini brownies.
GREAT FOOD!!!!!!! I am so sad that I didn't come sooner- this place is my new hyperfixation
No espresso machine working, coffee was alright. Sandwich was good. Extensive menu with different options, definitely not cheap. $11.23 + $2.00 for a Bacon egg and cheese. Not even NYC

We visited this location on a Friday morning and they were fairly busy.  Here are a couple of our observations.

1.  When you enter the restaurant is filled with natural light.  It feels warm and inviting.  The pastry case is the focal point straight ahead.  To your left is a coffee bar and to the right is the dining area.  The dining area is rather small so it would not be a place for large groups or people who are very loud.  The dining area was very clean and neat.

2.  They had really good customer service.  Everyone was kind and patient as we ordered.  They also bring your food out to your table when its done.  Our only complaint was the wait time.  It took a really long time to receive our sandwiches.  It was about 15 minutes.  The kitchen was a bit busy but it only appeared to be about 2 other orders ahead of us.

3.  The food was bland.  We ordered an egg provolone, and spinach croissant, turkey and cranberry club, pecan sticky bun, a chocolate croissant, and a caramel katte along with 2 orange juices.  Our order was about $45 (which we felt was reasonable).  While all of our food was ok, it was nothing memorable about it. We wanted to really love the pastries but we just didn't.

4.  You should try this location if you're in the area.  You'll get good service and decent food.  However, I would not make a special trip to dine here.
Very friendly place with great coffee and tee selection.  Love their pastries, especially muffins.
Great drinks, great bakery
Good quality food. Never disappointed after many visits.  Morning Glory muffins are one of the best I've ever tried. Jalapeno cheddar biscuit was great. When the sandwich I tried was good.
Very slow service
Uniquely good food, and searching to have dogs outside

The muffins I received just came out of a fridge. The aren't fresh baked and they are over $4 each. 9.40 for two low quality bagels. They aren't good. I could have gotten a four pack at the grocery store for the price of one and it wouldn't be cold. Ridiculous

Great spot in south Charlotte (ballentyne) for breakfast or lunch.  Top notch coffee with a. Great selection of baked goods including muffins, scones (lemon rosemary is great!) and Eclairs.  Skip the line at Starbucks and head over here.  They also have two for one day old muffins and scones.  Super clean bathrooms. A must try.   A+ best of the best in Ballantyne.
Really good biscuits!
Nice place
I had stomach upset after eating panini during breakfast. Will not go again
Amazing.
Amazing job on my daughter's sweet 16 birthday cake !!!

If you haven't been here. You're missing out! From the moment you walk inside of Sunflower Baking Company quietly nestled in the corners of Ballatyne your greeted by the sweet aroma of all the baking treats!! And if you love sweets like I do. You should try exactly what I had better yet splurge!! Like the lady behind the counter stated "YOU ASKED FOR IT!" Prepare to fall in love I'll be visiting often. Check it out for yourself. My items were The Morning Glory Muffin and The Cheese and Sausage Croissant. Pictures are worth 1 billion words right?!!
Great crossiants
This place is always great. Good iced coffee, sandwiches and definitley keylime pies!
Friendly staff, tasty croissants, and smooth lattes. Good dairy-free coffee options as well.
Great baked goods! Loved the croissants
The sugar roll and cheddar biscuits are unreal! So addictive.

My family loves this bakery! For years we have ordered allergy-safe cakes for our daughter who has multiple food allergies.  The bakers there have always been very accommodating with our orders, and we always have friends and guests asking where our "delicious" cakes are from. Thank you, sunflour bakery!
Lovely place, and cozy outside area

Some of the best that Charlotte has to offer. Nothing is stale and food is fresh. The atmosphere is chill work environment with bossa nova essentials taking you to a Brazilian space on a lazy afternoon. My egg cheddar avocado on a croissant was a fat bomb of flaky deliciousness. The egg is sous vide and soft melting in your mouth (a touch of maldon salt flakes would elevate but that's personal preference). Desserts are to be cheered and not devoured like a hypoglycemic clinging for a sugar fix but more of a prized possession savoring every bite. What I love about this place is it reminds me of  foreign bakeries as I travel the world regularly for work. I'm sincerely surprised by the fact it isn't 5 stars but understand the commercial, consumerist and rushed American buyer my not fully understand the purpose of this establishment. I will be back and bringing friends.

I've been coming here for years and have always had a great experience. There is a wide variety of pastries, including very well-made vegan and gluten-free options. Since my husband has Celiac's, and my nephew is vegan, we really appreciate that.

The breakfast sandwiches are varied and delicious. I highly recommend the rosemary bread.  It's yummy (not gluten free.)

I really like the coffee, and have enjoyed the varieties of non-dairy milks.

Overall--great place!

Obsessed with sunflour baking company. I usually order them through Uber eats & they're spot on every time. When i want something quick to order, this is my go to. The food NEVER disappoints, and you feel good about what you're eating. It's always delicious & fresh, and coffee is organic which is a MUST for me. Anything from here is so so good!! And customer service is excellent.

I've lived across the street for Sunflour Baking Company for a year and am so mad at myself for never giving it a try until now. My boyfriend and I went this morning for breakfast. We both LOVED our food. My matcha latte was absolutely perfect. I even went up again to order more. The macarons are HUGE and delicious! The ladies that work the front counter were so incredibly sweet and work super fast. We are absolutely going to be back.
The items we purchased were delicious

Absolutely the best morning place in Ballantyne for coffee. If you want fresher baked pastries, cakes or sandwiches - this is also your place. You can see into the kitchen and watch as they are in the back preparing the foods.
One of the best back egg and cheese croissants, wish their bacon was a little thicker

It was second time to this bakery. Nice location and outdoor seating option. Their Orange roll was light, flaky, crispy and mildly sweet. It was delicious and phenomenal.

First time I saw Pistachios milk. Tempted to try and ordered drip coffee with pistachios milk. The milk started curled up and didn't look right. When informed the barista, he was kind enough to try one more new cup of coffee, still curled up... I tossed it out

Good place to try for small good bakery with coffee and teas options
They were out of many things, so it wasn't a 5 star experience.  The employees seem a little less focused than normal on servicing the customers.
Always amazing
If you get there around 7:00 all the muffins are warm right out of the oven... so good!!!
Wow, Wow, Wow! I stumbled upon this place by accident. The cheese biscuit and banana chocolate muffin were amazing, and the seasonal coffee was excellent.
Fabulous bakery. Need more GF options!

We used Sunflour Baking Co. for our December wedding and were blown away by their baked goods and service leading up to it. When communicating with Lauren she was punctual and informative, the sample presentation was also incredible - after seeing what they were able to put together as the to-go sample order, we knew they were the perfect fit for our wedding. Lauren really listened to what we were looking for (mini winter themed desserts) and delivered perfectly. The wedding cake itself was also exactly what we were looking for, she worked off inspiration pictures and it was beautiful. We can't pick a favorite from all of the desserts they provided, they were all so tasty. We cannot recommend Sunflour enough and are so looking forward to getting more baked goods from you guys in the future. Thank you!! - Emily & Andy

OMG!!!! I get to CLT regularly and how did I not know about these guys. They have a few locations. I went to the one in Ballantyne. The food is amazing - gorgeous AND delicious. And the service is friendly. I will be back

The coffee and almost every pastry I've had are amazing. Also, the pastries are a very good serving size. Sometimes the wait can be long (especially for warm food), but it's all worth the wait if you have the time.
Really cute, clean bakery featuring sandwiches and soups in addition to coffee and baked goods. Every employee I encountered was polite and efficient and the food was fresh and tasty.
Friendly service
This place might have turned into my go to breakfast spot.
Love it!!

Not great service.  Went to try the cinnamon bun and ordered the last one in the case.  Sat down to wait for coffee and then was told they had no more cinnamon rolls.  They gave it to the people who ordered after us.
I love the eggs and avocado sandwich on a croissant. It's so flaky and buttery!! Definitely a must try!

I ate breakfast at Sunflower Baking Company in Ballantyne on Christmas Eve for the first time.  For my meal, I had the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich on a cheddar biscuit.  It was so delicious.  My date and I split a cinnamon roll, which was  incredible.  I took home a cheese cake for Christmas dinner and it was a big hit with my family.  I highly recommend Sunflower Baking Company.
Room temp food, questionable listening skills...mid over all
The customer service here is amazing! And the food is delicious! I would recommend this place to anyone & everyone!
Americana coffee not so good!
Delicious bakery, sandwiches and coffee

Buttery flaky everything.. I order it on postmates or stop in on the weekends. The staff is always great and jolly. Jalapeno Cheddar Biscuits are a must (have them warmed). Disclaimer, for me not all locations are as good as this one.
I love the sunflower bakery it is a very small cozy coffee House
Superb quality. Those cheese biscuits!!!!
Great cold brew and muffins .

I stepped by Sunflour bakery today, it was a wonderful experience.
Nice place, so delicious menu.
Friendly staff, I met Huda one of the staff their and she was so kind and helpful, she recommended their specialists, like morning glory muffin it was a "glory" , pumpkin muffin was so delicious
The croissants were buttery and crispy.
I probably should go back to try the  rest  of their menu as Huda recommended a lot!
All I had was delicious and had  balanced flavor,  I will definitely go back .

The food is DELICIOUS, but the kitchen takes awhile. Today, my to-go order was never sent to the back kitchen so I'm waiting here for it (with a 1 year old, and 1 week old baby at home... so I wanted it to be fast pickup). We have experienced this slower pace a few times, so I wouldn't come for a breakfast sandwich if you're in a rush -- but definitely come if you have some time. It's lovely location, friendly staff, and a delightful bakery.
They have a really nice cookies
Cinnamon roll...do it...get it heated
Delish but the coffee sucks
Delicious pastries and first class coffee.
Great friendly staff,and delicious pastries
One of my favorites!!

Baking goods and breakfast were great. Everything is fresh. Place looks clean. Service is a little slow during busy hours but not too bad. They offer vegan products too.
They have indoor and outdoor seating.

Wow what a great experience! I ordered delivery through Seamless for the first time, and a couple items weren't available -- I was immediately called and offered to substitute or receive a refund. The alternate options were incredible and I appreciated the kindness to even call and give me the option (instead of just canceling my order). I'm new to the area, but can't wait to visit in person and bring all my friends + family when they visit! Thank you!!
Cupcakes are great. Bonus: place smells of fresh coffee.
Cute coffee shop and atmosphere. Yummy pastries too
With a price of $8 for breakfast sandwich and the extended  wait time you could at least get it right. What a waste
The pastries aren't good. They take too long and constantly get the order wrong. The coffee is great.
Waiting more than an hour for a sandwich because they forgot to pass my order,  incredible!
Great little breakfast spot in Ballantyne. Sandwiches, muffins and coffee are awesome. Wait can be a little long but worth it.
The morning glory muffin was amazing. Coffee was good too. The staff was friendly! Restroom was clean. I'd come back if I'm ever traveling in this area again!
Good internet and kind staff
Victoria, you did an amazing job with the gluten free chocolate cake with a vanilla buttercream icing!! It was delicious and perfect

I have been frequenting SBC for about 4 years, always the Ballantyne location and once for catering. I am a HUGE fan of the food and drinks (see below), but there are some hiccups that others also have identified that can be frustrating.

First off, the food: fantastic (and I mean fantastic!) pastries, croissants, muffins, sandwiches and the like. I have never, ever been disappointed. I have had breakfast and lunch there on multiple occasions. I stop by occasionally for afternoon tea. I once even made a large catering order for the hospital where I work. Surprisingly, not a lot of people at work had heard of this place, but the food (sandwiches, salads and drinks) were universally loved and I know, for sure, that that catered lunch led to a number of new enthusiastic SBC customers.

For caffeine enthusiasts, their roasts are high-quality and they have a diverse offering of coffees (all from local CLT-area companies) and teas. The tea, Rishi, is quality, but overpriced at more than $4/cup.

I genuinely appreciate that they emphasize their local roots, highlighting local ingredients and promoting other local companies in their products. Hooray for the small guys! The staff are always friendly and as helpful as possible.

The one see where I think SBC can improve is efficiency and communication. When I tried catering, I had to call due to a problem with my online order. The person on the phone, located at the Ballantyne location, had no idea how to solve my problem and said, "sorry, we get no training for online orders." I ended up paying more than I was supposed to. Similarly, in the store, i occasionally have long waits for items. More recently, I stopped by for afternoon tea. After 15 minutes of waiting, I went back up to the counter and the woman there sincerely apologized, saying, "I'm so sorry, I thought the other person had made it already."

Despite these hiccups, which are human errors and mild in the grand scheme of things, I genuinely love SBC. I have brought many friends here, all of whom also have loved their products. I would highly recommend any time!
Nice to have a charming and quaint bakery in this city. All their pastries/breads/baked goods are delicious and taste freshly baked. And a good tea selection from a good brand for tea lovers.
Food is excellent. All freshly prepared. Little on the expensive side but worth it. Sometimes the line moves very slowly

My Southern BLT sandwich was incredible, the macaron was massive and super delicious. Their drinks were really good too, my girlfriends matcha latte has really good and my Jasmine green tea was super high quality. Super good service to top it all off. We'll definitely be back! :)
Everyone is so nice ! The coffee is great & so is the carrot muffin!

We absolutely love Sunflour Baking Company! They serve organic coffee and they have several milk choices as well. Best morning glory muffins and almond croissants! Friendly staff and bright cheery atmosphere!

Amazing experience at this wonderful bakery! The sweet girls behind the counter were very helpful picking out our delicious cookies, they have a great variety of yummy treats, sandwiches,  soups, teas, and coffee. Breakfast sandwiches,  and breads!!! Everyone should check put this SWEET spot for all their yummy cravings!
Very tasty pastry with nice hot drinks.

I love this place. Great coffee and light breakfast items at a reasonable price. I had a cappuccino which was perfectly done. Also had a vegan banana chocolate muffin which was delicious. The place is very nice and functional. Lots of natural light but simple at the same time. There's outdoor seating as well. The staff was kind and fast. This is what a local coffee place should be like. I'm from Atlanta and wish I could find something like this.
Had a very nice cortado and a coconut macaron from here earlier today. Fair prices and delicious items. Definitely check them out if you're in the area.
The pastries are to die for and the service is A+

I am so disappointed by this location! Sunflour is one of my favorite places for a breakfast sandwich and pastry. I have been to all of there locations in the Charlotte & surrounding area. This one continues to have problems. Their pastries are about the only thing that stay consistent. Their #2 is currently a pregnancy craving of mine, I add the basil/walnut pesto with avocado. I have been given the sandwich missing an egg, with an ice cold egg and no cheese, with the tomato pesto instead (which is not good IMO), missing the avocado, etc. It boggles my mind how EVERY SINGLE TIME something is wrong with the sandwich. Ive ordered online, over the phone, and in person. It doesnt matter, wrong everytime. This is the closest location to me and it's still 30 minutes away. I wont be going here anymore sadly and will just have to make the drive to the other locations. The staff seem like they mean well but goodness, someone has got to whip things into shape.
This morning I went to the bakery and ordered a large coffee, black. Unfortunately, it took over 20 minutes to make the coffee. I left and I hope they enjoy their free coffee.
Royal service!
Call ahead for the Jalapeno Cheddar Biscuits!!!  Worth it Everytime

Unfortunately, I was charged twice when using the Sunflour App because  their system went down.
They have taken care of this matter and written an apology email including a gift card for the many inconveniences. I am grateful!

We ordered online and the sandwiches (especially the cheddar biscuits) were soooo good! The catch is that the pastries in the display case tasted like they had been sitting in a refrigerator too long, and we ended up getting really sick from them. It's also a little pricey.

Poor customer service. I walked in and cashier was on the phone with her back turned to me for ten minutes.  A young lady walked to the front from the back to help. After I told her picking up online order she went and got it dropped it and turned around and left. Didn't even wait to make sure my order was right. The writing was wrong. The other lady was still on the phone with her back to me. I just left. Doubtful I'll be ordering my cake here again. There are too many cake places to waste my time here. So sad how bad the customer service has become. I have ordered bday cakes here for the past 3 years.
Hands down, the best croissants I've had in the Charlotte area.
This location is best to me. You must try a breakfast sandwich with the English muffin. Lmk how you like it

I called to have a cake made for my birthday and was placed on hold for 20-25 minutes. When I hung up and attempted to call back my calls wouldn't go through. Finally I called private and the phone rung. The person I initially spoke with answered the phone. She said "well..... I need another 20 minutes." Why not say "I'm busy and working by myself" the first time I called. That would have saved me a lot of time. I decided to contact another company

Very disappointing. Waited 15 minutes for our food and were then told they forgot to make it. Rather than make it right away, they made us wait another 15 minutes while they filled other orders. Sandwiches were severely lacking- sloppily made and mostly bread. Won't return.

Yummy egg sandwiches, LOVE their cheddar biscuits, muffins are delicious, iced coffees are pretty good and the seating inside and out is very nice. They don't do a great job with their hot coffees tho
Delicious sandwiches and  biscuits. Good service. Outside seating.
The cream puff was really good

Just went here today 1-3-22 after a year due to virus...Food still fresh but my Morning Glory muffin has 3 small pockets of baking soda (that's what it tasted like) in it. I'm guessing just simple human error in not mixing the batter correctly. I will go again because for the past few years, I've never had a bad experience here until today.
Good food but customer service is lacking. Tried different locations , excellent bakery.
Great breakfast sandwich! Great coffee
Amazing croissant. Nice place, very good coffee .
Cute little bakery

Sandwich was good.   The rosemary bread was delicious.   Unfortunately they ran out of the pimiento cheese, which I think would have made the sandwich better and is the only reason I'm only giving them 4 stars.

I try to patronize local establishments but  I can no longer support this Sunflour Ballantyne location. I have been going to this bakery periodically for the past 3 years. They have good pastries but their breakfast and lunch sandwiches are disappointing. They are often sloppily prepared or missing an ingredient.  They are also slow in preparing orders. We have to go out of way to come to this store - it is not nearby. After numerous issues, we will just stop patronizing this business.

Also there is supposed to be a mask policy in this store which is clearly indicated by the sign on the front door. We  were wearing our masks when not eating and social distancing from others in the shop, the employee at the register had her mask down under her chin.

I love this place. Friendly/energetic staff, good food, and easy parking. The croissants are spectacularly flaky/messy. There are lots of small tables with outlets, so it's a good spot for a lunch meeting or working remotely.

My only complaints are:
1. The wait time for sandwiches can be particularly long, especially at lunch.
2. I've been told 10 minutes after I place an order (and pay for it) that a certain ingredient/sandwich is out of stock. This specific scenario has happened more than once. I get it that everyone is having supply chain issues right now, but you could let me know before the order is rung up.
3. It really stinks when I open my sandwich at home and see that one or two ingredients on my non-customized order were forgotten. :( This happens not infrequently.
Great food & employees. Anahita & Huda are sooooo nice. Apologize if I misspelled your names.

I put in an order for a cake a few days ago for my son's birthday. When I show up today to pick it up, they didn't make it. They refunded me my money and didn't even offer me a free cookie. It was almond raspberry cake, it's not easy finding Italian desserts in this city
Everything we got was not good. The coffee was the worst.
Good eats and fast service. My family loved it.

By far the BEST croissants in all USA. Go to France for better. But these are the best. Sandwiches are great, French press coffee, excellent. 
There are other sweets, cupcakes, cookies, key lime pie, tarts, each day is different. Croissants are a staple, order them!
food is always good but the coffee is different every time.. i order the same latte but it never has the same taste or texture.

Stopped in here to grab breakfast and take a meeting before flying home. Amazing double espresso and the best croissant I've had here in the states, easily. Great staff, real coffee, great food. I wish I lived there just to go back again tomorrow

Perfect breakfast place. Stop by for a coffee and some pastries.  They also do cakes if your interested in those. The food is delicious, you can tell that there is time and effort being put into what they make. If you come down later in the day, it's really quiet so it's if your a peaceful person, that time would be great. Location is pretty good too, considering the main ballentyne business centers are not too far from here. Definitely stop by.
Not impressed at all. The prices are extremely high for very basic food
Everything is alwaya amazing at Sunflour bakery. Must try!
They have delicious vegan, gluten free bakery options. The coffee is great; they use Counter Culture beans. I always receive friendly service here!
Healthy food choices. The queue was long. The menu on the internet was slightly different
Don't let wait staff keep tips.
Great vibe! Love the decor! Vegan options! Awesome coffee. Employee was super nice.
The food is amazing! The staff is so kind, helpful, and efficient! Bonus points to the staff member who was so kind and brought our food out to us and said hello to our puppy!
Best customer service ever.
Great service and food especially muffins and breakfast sandwiches.
Muffins & latte was great but the employee... she was not nice lol.
We love the muffins and breakfast sandwiches.
Great coffee and panini today.  Will be coming back for some baked goods!
It takes 30 minutes to get a sandwich and a breakfast burrito. This wasn't an isolated incident. Every single time I go its at least 20 minutes waiting for a sandwich.

How does a bakery not have eggs on a Sunday morning at 9am? Not exactly an ingredient that cannot be picked up at any local supermarket. This is obviously an extremely poorly managed location which leads to overall poor customer service.

I ordered a gluten free raspberry cake for my daughters birthday, hoping it would be amazing. Unfortunately it was awful, we ended up tossing the cake. Biggest waste of $50.00. Stay away from their gluten free menu.
Nice muffins

Just tried to order ONE breakfast sandwich and they told me it would be 25-30 minute wait for ONE sandwich because a to go order was just called in. Meanwhile two people in back decorating cupcakes. Not appropriately staffed then. Will not return.

Convenient for me, always great and clean.
My go to place on the weekends
Bakery goods look tempting. Employees are nice and the interior is clean and you can see the kitchen and the people working.

Great experience here the two times I've been so far! Nice staff, yummy coffee, and the Avocado Melt is delicious, which is a spinach, goat cheese, roasted tomato, walnut pesto and avocado panini. It's so good. I also got an iced vanilla oat milk latte. Highly recommend trying this place!
Great little place to have lunch with a friend, good food.
Great baked goods!!!

Nice place, there are several tables inside and there is an opportunity to sit at tables outside.  The service is fast and friendly.  I liked the fact that many delicacies are baked there themselves.  Pleasant aroma of pastries with a light touch of coffee.
Good place to grab breakfast.
Cozy atmosphere with fresh baked pastries. Lovely place to meet a friend for coffee!
Enjoyed the same great quality food we have had at the Harrisburg location. Cinnamon buns are still my go-to.
Several Gluten Free options (see photos...yes, it's all GF). Everything looked and smelled delicious. Friendly and helpful cashier.
Great food, great staff! Huda served us and was very patient with us. She took our orders and got them all spot on. Very clean all around. Highly recommend! The croissants are the best I've ever had.
Great assortment of vegan muffins. My go to is the Chocolate Chip and Banana muffin.
Enjoyed a great avocado panini and grilled cheese panini followed by a few homemade cookies!  Delish!
Really good sandwiches !! Coffee is excellent. Great choice of vegan pastries and many options for dairy-free alternatives
The best food and coffee.  Super cute.
Best morning glory muffin I've ever tasted.
Lovely!
The morning glory muffin is delicious! If you haven't tried it, you definately should.

Discovered this place by accident to be honest.. but I can say one thing - they have great coffee and amazing pastries! A must try for sure, be it for coffee paired with a delicious pastry or a more substantial meal.
Excellent croissants and breakfast sandwiches. Nice selection of baked goods.
They have great weekend bakery sandwiches.
Great people

First time here, came as a party of two. As most cafes you order pay and then seat yourself. I ordered an orange blossom tea and they iced it for me. The second half of my party ordered herself an iced dirty chai. The drinks were perfect! To go we ordered a chocolate peanut butter cupcake and an individual key lime pie. The place is pleasant and the person who took our order was nice, didn't rush us, and helpful! Thank you. I will be back for sure.
Cheddar biscuits are the best for any breakfast sandwich.

I'm gonna comment on their croissants.  Several years ago my wife and I tried their croissants and at the time we decided these are the greatest croissants we'd EVER eaten... ANYWHERE!  Since then we pretty much try croissants at every bakery we can find to see if there is an equal or better croissant.  We're happy to announce that after 5 years of trying, Sunflour Bakery is STILL the number one croissant we've ever eaten.  There are only two other runner-ups at a place called Mocco Bistro and a place called Crema, both in Charlotte.  Interestingly, many of the other things we try at Sunflour are only meh and almost EVERYTHING we have at Crema is perfect so bear that in mind.  As for croissants Sunflour is the BEST
What a great place to get some pastries, coffee, and a breakfast sandwich. Everything we ordered was delicious and the staff was great. Definitely will be back.
This place is so cute! The scones are amazing and I love the coffee! The service is always so fast! Great place to stop in for breakfast!
super cute place!

Sunflour Baking is a phenomenal spot to pop into! They have an array of delicious sandwiches, bakery items, and a wide variety of your coffee needs. We had the scrumptious cheddar biscuits as breakfast sandwiches and they were amazing! Highly recommend that as your bread choice! The staff was incredibly kind and welcomed us to the area in the best way! Defintely recommend coming here, so many things to try we will make this a weekly stop!
Great little bakery and cafe
I have door dashed from here several times - the food is outstanding.  The best breakfast sandwich I've ever had!  10/10

No surprise the place was empty on Saturday @ lunch time.
The eggs cheddar avocado was the  worst food I've had in a long time.
I feel sick after the so called egg...
The expresso could not drink, the sour taste must've been from a unclean machine or bad coffee.
Just an awful place, I don't think will ever go back...
Delicious offerings!  Morning Glory muffin is my favorite!

I want to give a huge shoutout to Stacey for always providing excellent service every time I've been there to pickup or dining in. I love  the atmosphere and quality of food and drinks. I highly recommend stopping by if you are looking for something delicious or refreshing.

Ordered a breakfast sandwich then waited 30 minutes.  Asked about my order then waited another 15 minutes.  Sandwich finally comes out and I mentioned it took 45 minutes.  I got "oh" from the server.  I understand that they may have to-go orders, but you can't make a quick sandwich for the guy sitting there for a half hour?

I was pleasantly surprised by the selection of gluten free bakery items. I was tempted by the individual GF key lime pie and GF cheesecake, but I got a delicious pumpkin cranberry muffin with a drip coffee. The customer service was excellent as well. My friend got a cookie and a mocha latte that she enjoyed as well.
The food was delicious. The service was great. Reasonably priced.
Great food and drinks , great atmosphere only problem try to avoid busy times
One of the few spots in Charlotte I've found to make a solid cappuccino. Great little hidden spot with really kind employees. Look forward to coming back!!
Great first impression! Beautiful pastries and muffin display. Clean establishment, and everything tastes great!

Wonderful and welcoming staff and lovely coffee - and for those who are taking coffees to go, these lids, cups, stoppers are magical! I had two of four cups flip over onto the top when I took a turn too quickly and only a few drops spilled in the few minutes it took to be able to flip them right side up. I'm still shocked and so thankful!

So, first off, let me say that we love SBC. However, the ballantyne location is horrific. DO NOT GO!!! Not only are they severely understaffed, but they are very unprepared for their customer volume. We placed an order on Saturday morning via their mobile app, and we waiting for our time to get our food.  Good thing we walked in and checked in on the order because they had cancelled our order without even telling us bc they ran out of eggs!!! How is that even possible? Prepare better.

Secondly, when I was giving the young girl a bit of customer feedback on having a better system of letting customers know if their orders had been cancelled (we received no notification whatsoever) - she was EXTREMELY unprofessional rude, and passive aggressive. At that point, I was stunned how she had spoken to me. Not only did she blame ME, the customer, but she couldn't just do the right thing in a customer service role and apologize for the delay and poor service. She copped an attitude and became very passive aggressive.

So, not only are they losing our business, but I am writing this google review to allow others to have a piece of helpful info before ordering from them.

Sunflour Baking Company - choose your employees carefully and wisely. If you do not instruct them on the proper ways to diffuse situations with customers, then they should not be dealing with them. If you teach them and they still do not adhere, then they should not be employed. It's as simple as that. I have over 15+ years in customer service and today I was completely and utterly amazed at how this girl spoke to me.

I have to say that I do not recommend this store. I have a friend who is gluten free and I needed 20 cupcakes for her baby shower. I called 2 days ahead and ordered. First the person that was one the phone had no idea what the flavors were that were available. I will note I  will take ownership that I did not ask how Much the order would be, but the price was not discussed. I figured it would more expensive than traditional cupcakes but goodness 20 cups were $87!! $3.50 per cupcake. A vanilla and/ or chocolate cupcake with pink frosting, nothing fancy!! If I had known I would have ordered 2 for the mom and then gone to Publix and gotten the other 18 for the same price as the 2? I don't get it. My husband said " put the gluten back in for that price" also it's not like they were any bigger than a food lion/ Harris teeter cupcake. This was my first time getting anything here, so not impressed. Not to mention they were running so far behind I had to wait in line just to pick up the preordered cupcakes. The person on the register had no idea what she was doing and they were running out of things for other people who were waiting. So many people waiting on food. Again my first impression was NOPE!!
Just as good as the original! Get the cheddar biscuit or the rosemary bread.

The almond croissant is amazing!!! Also love the biscuit that the bacon, egg, and cheese comes on though I've yet to get actually crispy bacon despite my requests. This is our family's favorite local breakfast place.

I usually love Sunflour and their Dilworth location is great, but I have a couple complaints with this location.  They rarely open on time, which is annoying when you're trying to stop there before work.  Sometimes they open up to 30 minutes late.  Also, their muffins are almost always undercooked and gooey inside (completely raw at times), which is a health hazard.  Every single time I've ordered the Morning Glory muffin it's been raw inside, which is sad because it's my favorite.  If they could fix these two things, I'd be there all the time.

The pastries and coffee here is amazing. You can tell that they use a good quality coffee. The breakfast sandwich and paninis are probably the biggest hidden gem. I ended up going to this place 3 times in a week trying different items because we were so pleased with the products and the customer service.

I ordered a tiramisu 2 days ago, just to try Sunflour for the first time. Tiramisu anywhere I have had it, always is prepared using alcohol. This is what gives it the distinct taste.
This dessert was apparently prepared as a child's version, no alcohol. The texture was like an old overcooked cake, not the creamy, moist dessert that tiramisu is.
For all that like an authentic tasting  tiramisu this is not it. I haven't tried other desserts here, but I may.

So I ordered a cake about 2 weeks in advance, vegan vanilla cake with vanilla frosting (my sons is allergic to milk and eggs). I asked if they did kids designs, I was looking for a PJ masks cake. They said sure and sent me a picture example of the cake they would make. When the time cake to pick up the cake....it barely looked ANYTHING like the example they sent to us. We paid $45 for a tiny 6" cake with added decorations that looked like it wasn't worth even $20!! And that's not even mentioning the fact that the inside actual cake was UNDERCOOKED and super dense and mushy (see picture). Here is the example they showed us and then pictures of the cake we picked up.....two stars only because they offer vegan cakes and the staff was friendly.....

all around best breakfast and dessert place recommend to anybody who's looking for fresh baked items - croissants , cupcakes and biscuits. Great friendly staff !
coffee is fresh

Ordered a birthday cake for my wife. They were extremely helpful. Great follow up.  The cake tasted fantastic (we got the triple chocolate). It wasn't too "fluffy".  Instead, it was very dense and rich. I will definitely order my next cake from here!
Their gluten free vegan carrot cake muffin is delectable.
Glad to have location in ballantyne,
Best pastries on the planet...
Everything I've had has been delicious and served with a smile! They also have a few vegan options as well.

Liked the place a lot....nice atmosphere inside....huge palm in the middle makes up for a tropical feel....loved the eclairs...not too sweet, just as I like it...nice chicken sandwich....good quality coffees....clean and cozy

Second time here for a relaxing Sunday breakfast croissant sandwich and french press coffee both of which are sublime and wondering why I'm not coming to this place every day--friendly service and unpretentious atmosphere. Worth checking out especially during the post church service crush when every other place is slammed. Our sandwiches arrived in under ten minutes--and so amazingly delish.

The cinnamon bun was absolutely fantastic!!! The real deal all the way!!! I also had the bacon, egg, and cheddar on their homemade biscuit bread. It was fantastic! I had an excellent breakfast today!!!

Stopped by to get a treat for kids after a doctors appointment.  Very cute space and loved the tall ceilings.  We got the raspberry eclair (a bit too chilled and wish not so much glaze on pastry portion) and pumpkin/apple muffin (but dry).  They were fine but nothing amazing to bring us back.  I will have to return to try breakfast or lunch and a coffee selection.

One negative (which I don't believe is viable to change) is while eating we saw the restaurant across the way pulling catering pans from a van and just hosing them down and leaving on the ground beside the restaurants trash cans.  Just not a scene you want to view while eating: trash bags and cans and pans being rinsed with hose.

I have been a long time customer of Sunflour Baking Company and sadly I think I will have to move on after today's experience. I have never had a friendly staff experience, but I withstood it bc dang, I love their scones and it was worth it. But today, there was no heat in the space (I wore gloves while indoors), the staff acted as though I was inconveniencing them and their point system was not working today, with no offer of a resolution. I also got charged 75 cents for oat milk without warning, which is not ok for an already overpriced matcha latte. I can't believe I'm saying this but I wish I had gone to Starbucks today instead
A great place for scones, muffins, and cappuccinos!

Visited this spot with family over Thanksgiving. Aesthetically pleasing and the best part as a mom was the outdoor seating area so the kiddos could move around and talk while the adults sat and talked.
My brokers loved the treats I brought in from here. The staff was friendly and quick. Lots of choices to choose from.
Ran out of eggs on Sunday morning! No attempt to get any. Tables and chairs not cleaned.
I am disappointed! No normal coffee cup. No skim milk. Coffee so hot that it is impossible to drink.
They usually run out of everything that's good.  Most people like this place.
This one is bigger and I love this place nice staff

Fabulous bakery for sweets and savory snacks and breakfast sandwiches all day! Love the bacon & eggs and cheese on a croissant! Their cinnamon rolls are incredible! And their cookies and pastries are delicious!!

I go here all the time because it's very close to work. The food is good. The soup is amazing. Baked goods are delicious.

However, the service can be so slow. Recently I've had some bad experiences there because of how busy it is. I went in, spent over $11 for lunch and when I got back to work I found my order was completely wrong. I called, Stacey told me they had a $20 gift card waiting for me and apologized. I let it go and appreciated the customer service. About a week later I go to pick up my gift card. It was VERY busy, lots of "mature" aged people being very particular about things and asking loads of questions. I only get a 30 minute lunch break so I was in a rush to pick up the gift card then leave to pick up my lunch from somewhere else. I waited 15 min just to talk to the new girl at the register to get my card...she filled it out and I rushed out. An hour later I'm at work and pull it out of my purse and realize it's only for $10. So they messed that up to so my gift card didn't even cover the cost of the meal they screwed up. I haven't bothered to call again to rectify it. Again I will say the food is yummy but just so many screw ups lately makes me not want to go back when I usually go at least twice a week.
Very disappointed. Was not happy with the service
Good coffee!
Great place
The sandwiches are old and tasteless. Not sure about the bread. Everything is overpriced. Menu is boring.

Cashier had limited knowledge of the menu and items. Came in and asked what the soup of the day was. She had to ask the manager if they even had soup, which they do not. Ordered the avocado melt, out of avocados. I asked for an additional veggie to be put on my sandwich and she was extremely confused. We asked if the ham was country ham, or sweet ham. She said "I don't know, I haven't tried the ham." And stood there, dumbfounded. We said "anyone you can ask?" She proceeded to ask the kitchen, "has anyone tried the ham?!". They had to read the package it came in, to let us know it was a boars Head honey ham. Asked for the a different sandwich on a cheddar biscuit. They say they are out of cheddar biscuits. The cook chimes in and says they just came out of the oven. We heard them tell multiple people on the phone and in store they were out, even after the fact. Bakery shelves basically empty. We were excited to come here. Poor experience.

Ps. no soap in the men's room.
Water jug unfilled.

Web site boasts gluten free, but nothing is available on a daily basis.  Also,  staff was not knowledgable about special orders. Train your staff. I cannot wait for a manager to be on the premises.  It really is a glorified coffee shop, not a bakery.
Delicious!
The Dirty Mocha was excellent though the service is not as fast as I would have liked. The cinnamon buns are wonderful.
Cheddar biscuits. Croissants. Orange hazelnut roll. Cinnamon roll. Fleur de Sal Chocolate Cookie. All are my favorite things at Sunflour Bakery. Yum!
Fabulous breakfast sandwiches.  Live to meet people there.  Always great customer service
Delicious!!!
It had decent options for baked goods and the limeade I got was tasty.
Our first time.  Popped in for Vegan brownies for some company we were having over later. Ended up  having breakfast.  Delish!
Great Place! Highly Recommend
Excellent baked goods

They have the BEST Almond Croissants! They're flaky, buttery, and delicious. I like Sunflour menu and the staff at the Ballantyne location. There is so many items I would recommend on their menu from the cheese biscuits to the key lime pie. This is a great place to eat with great pastries!
Nice quaint place tucked in the corner. Service was good, helpful. Little hot during lunch. May have been A/C issue. 2nd one that day for me.
Great little local bakery in Charlotte. Their blueberry muffin is really delicious. Coffee is local and always hot.
Great pastry nice employees.
